title: Find NCCL2 debians in Tensorflow configure
body_html:
Continuation of #20155

The Tensorlfow configure doesn't work with NCCL2 when it is installed via the debians.
This PR adds code that will handle the following scenarios:

NCCL2 installed via unpacked .tar file and not listed in ldconfig
NCCL2 installed via unpacked .tar file and listed properly in ldconfig
NCCL2 installed via debian file and not listed in ldconfig
NCCL2 installed via debian file and listed properly in ldconfig

The debian places the lib and header in the system paths (/usr/lib/*-linux-gnu and /usr/include). A new environment variable NCCL_HDR_PATH was created to deal with the divergence in the lib and header paths in this scenario. The third_party/nccl/nccl_configure.bzl file was changed to look up the new environment variable for the header location.

body:
Continuation of https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/20155

The Tensorlfow configure doesn't work with NCCL2 when it is installed via the debians.
This PR adds code that will handle the following scenarios:

    NCCL2 installed via unpacked .tar file and not listed in ldconfig
    NCCL2 installed via unpacked .tar file and listed properly in ldconfig
    NCCL2 installed via debian file and not listed in ldconfig
    NCCL2 installed via debian file and listed properly in ldconfig

The debian places the lib and header in the system paths (`/usr/lib/*-linux-gnu` and `/usr/include`). A new environment variable `NCCL_HDR_PATH` was created to deal with the divergence in the lib and header paths in this scenario. The `third_party/nccl/nccl_configure.bzl` file was changed to look up the new environment variable for the header location.
